Home.HomeSeoTitle: SlotStat: Real-Time Slot Statistics & Data-Driven Gambling Insights
Home.HomeSeoDesc: Explore SlotStat for real-time slot statistics and insights. Discover RTP, Win Spin Rate, and more to make smarter decisions while playing.

faq.stayInLoop: Stay noted for upcoming updates and chase some bounty rewards.
faq.WhatIsHappeningHereParams: Win Spin Rate is a frequency of winning spins, where win is counted if higher than initial bet.
faq.WhatIsHappeningHereEnd: cThose parameters may defer by casinos, providers and/or games.
faq.WhatIsSlotstatContent: SlotStat, a neutral observer in the gambling realm, meticulously displays slot game statistics to enhance players' gaming experiences. Providing essential features such as RTP, RTP Swing, Win Spin Regular, bonuses, JACKPOT, Max X, and SPS data, SlotStat empowers players with comprehensive insights for informed gaming decisions
faq.WhatsHitRateContent: Max X, also known as the maximum win multiplier, signifies the highest potential payout a slot game offers. This value represents how many times your initial bet you can win under ideal conditions. For instance, if a game has a Max X of 1200X, it means you could potentially win 1200 times your bet amount. This multiplier adds excitement and anticipation to gameplay, as players aim for the chance to achieve significant wins relative to their wagers.
faq.WhatIsRTPContent: RTP SWING real-time tool shows slot game’s fluctuation towards its own ideal RTP at a very exact moment of present (updates once in 5 min.).
faq.fluctuationContent: SPS stands for Slot Profit Status, a real-time indicator displayed on our site to show whether a slot game's Live Return to Player (RTP) is greater than, less than, or equal to its Theoretical RTP.How is SPS calculated?SPS is represented as a percentage, reflecting the difference between the Live RTP and the Theoretical RTP. For example: If the Theoretical RTP is 97%, but the Live RTP is 120%, the SPS would be +23%, indicating that the slot game has paid out 23% more than expected. Conversely, if the Live RTP is 90%, the SPS would be -7%, indicating that the slot game has paid out 7% less than expected. How often is SPS updated? SPS is a live updating feature, with updates occurring every 5 minutes. This ensures that players have access to the most current information about a slot game's performance. Understanding the additional digits: In addition to the main SPS percentage, you may notice smaller digits beneath it. These smaller digits represent the change in SPS since the previous update. They can be either positive or negative, indicating whether the slot game has performed better or worse compared to the previous update. For example: If the previous SPS was 7%, and the new SPS is 5%, the smaller digits would display '-2%' in red, indicating a decrease in performance. If the next update shows an SPS of 6%, the smaller digits would display 1% in green, indicating an improvement compared to the previous update. We hope this helps you understand SPS better and enhances your experience on SlotStat.net!
faq.activateBonus: How do I activate a bonus or promotion on SlotStat?

table.maxXHint: Max X represents the maximum potential win multiplier, indicating the highest possible payout in multiples of your bet.
table.SPSHint: Slot Profit Status (SPS) indicates whether a slot is winning or losing relative to theoretical RTP. Positive (+) denotes profit, while negative (-) reflects losses. Updated every 5 minutes, red signifies a decrease from the prior 5 minutes, and green indicates an increase. SPS and color changes provide real-time insights into game performance
table.sourceHint: Information source of statistics. 1. Casino API - 2. Slotstat AI - 3. Verified -
table.jackpotHint: Figurine is an actively updating maximum Jackpot value of the chosen casino and may pop up as an accurate periscope for sharp shot takers.
table.userHint: Number of users who monitor statistics
table.casinoBonusHint: Bonuses listed on SlotStat can be activated by visiting the bonus section on the game page and clicking on the corresponding bonus card. Sometimes special codes should be used for bonuses, which can be found in bonus cards.
table.h1GameHint: Figurine shows the percentage of Win Spin Rate in the last hour time period.
table.h24GameHint: Figurine shows the percentage of Win Spin Rate in the last 24 hour time period.
table.RTPhint: Return to Player (RTP) is a fundamental term in gambling and online games, denoting the percentage of funds returned to players based on their initial deposits. This measure ensures fairness and sets player expectations, highlighting the transparency and integrity of gaming experiences, minimum RTP is enforced in some countries.
table.playHint: Play button directly sends the player to the selected slot on the chosen casino interface. Via the Play button SlotStat keeps tabs on player preferences and improves its mechanism based on this information.

gamePage.Win-spinRateHint: Win Spin Rate is mathematically calculable quantity and expresses a frequency of winning spins, where win is higher than initial bet.

noStatistic: Oops, we will update statistics soon!!
itemNotFound: No results! Try a different search.

notification.cookieText: By clicking “Accept All Cookies”, you agree to the storing of cookies on your device to enhance site navigation, analyze site usage, and assist in your marketing efforts.

RTP.provideInfo: We will provide RTP Information soon

chartComponent.RTPhint: RTP Swing is an indicator reflecting fluctuations between theoretical and actual RTP (Return to Player) in slot games, updating every 5 minutes. The game's algorithm is trained towards achieving the theoretical RTP, but due to the dynamic nature of gameplay, the actual RTP may exceed, fall short of, or match the theoretical RTP. This live-updating metric provides insights into the game's performance at any given moment.
